model.scope

Class ScopeGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.scope.ScopeGraph

  • public class ScopeGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    The ScopeGraph class provides six methods to quickly build a Scope Graph To build a Scope Graph, first use the generateScope() method to generate all scopes. You can specify the number of scopes directly, and the Scope ID of the Scope is automatically incrementing. Or generate a Scope with the contents of the input array as its serial number. Then concatenates each Scope together using the method used to build the Edge Example: 
         
      ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph();
      scopeGraph.generateScope(1);

      Name referencex4 = scopeGraph.makeReference(1, "x", 4);
      scopeGraph.makeReference(1, "x", 8);

      scopeGraph.makeDeclaration(1, "x", 1);
      scopeGraph.makeDeclaration(1, "y", 3);

      void makeDirectEdge(int childrenScopeId, int parentScopeId)
      Establish a DeclrationEdge between a Parent Scope and a Children Scope Example: establish DirectEdge between Scope 1 and Scope 2 ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph(); scopeGraph.generateScope(5); scopeGraph.makeDirectEdge(2, 1);

      void printDotForScopeGraph()
      Print Scope Graph in Dot language on the console Example: ScopeGraph scopeGraph = ScopeGraphCreater.ScopeGraphFirgure2(); scopeGraph.printDotForScopeGraph();
      ScopeGraph selfCopy()
      Create a new Scope Graph that does not share data with the original Scope Graph ScopeGraph scopeGraph = ScopeGraphCreater.ScopeGrapFirgure3Left(); ScopeGraph copy = scopeGraph.selfCopy(); copy.printDotForScopeGraph();

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScopeGraph

        public ScopeGraph()
        Constructs an empty ScopeGraph

      • ScopeGraph

        public ScopeGraph(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,model.scope.Name> nameMap,
                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,model.scope.Scope> scopeMap)
        Constructs a ScopeGraph containing the elements of the specified map
        Parameters:
        nameMap - the HashMap whose mapppings are to be placed in this Scope Graph. This map contains Scope Graph's name
        scopeMap - the HashMap whose mappings are to be placed int this Scope Graph. This map contains Scope Graph's scope

    • Method Detail

      • generateScope

        public void generateScope(int amount)
        Generate n scopes, n == amount. ScopeId will increment on the basis of existing ScopeId. Scopeid starts at 1 Example: Generate a Scope Graph with five scopes 
             
      ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph();
      scopeGraph.generateScope(5);
        Parameters:
        amount - the number of Scope

      • generateScope

        public void generateScope(int[] intArray)
        Generate some Scopes using the input array element as a scopeId Example: Use 1, 2, and 3 as scopeId to generate three Scope graphs 
              
       ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph();
       scopeGraph.generateSope(new in[]{1,2,3});
        Parameters:
        intArray - the array whose elements are to be used as scopeId

      • makeDeclaration

        public model.scope.Name makeDeclaration(int scopeId,
                                        java.lang.String variableName,
                                        int variableId)
        Establish a DeclrationEdge between a Scope and a Declaration Example: Add Declaration x1 to Scope1 
              
       ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph();
       scopeGraph.generateScope(5);
       scopeGraph.makeDeclaration(1, "x", 1);
        Parameters:
        scopeId - the scopeId of the Scope that want to create the Edge
        variableName - Declaration's name
        variableId - Declaration's Id
        Returns:
        the Declaration

      • makeDirectEdge

        public void makeDirectEdge(int childrenScopeId,
                           int parentScopeId)
        Establish a DeclrationEdge between a Parent Scope and a Children Scope Example: establish DirectEdge between Scope 1 and Scope 2 
             
      ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph();
      scopeGraph.generateScope(5);
      scopeGraph.makeDirectEdge(2, 1);
        Parameters:
        childrenScopeId - parent's scopeId
        parentScopeId - children's scopeId

      • makeNominalEdge

        public model.scope.Name makeNominalEdge(int scopeId,
                                        java.lang.String variableName,
                                        int variableId)
        Firstly, establishs a NominalEdge between a Scope and its Reference. Then, creates a ReferenceEdge between the Scope and the Reference Automaticallly Example: Add Reference A5 to the Scope3 
             
      ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph();
      scopeGraph.generateScope(5);
      Name moduleA5 = scopeGraph.makeNominalEdge(3, "A", 5);
        Parameters:
        scopeId - Scope's Id
        variableName - Reference's name
        variableId - Reference's name
        Returns:
        the Reference

      • makeAssociation

        public model.scope.Name makeAssociation(int declarationScopeId,
                                        java.lang.String variableName,
                                        int variableId,
                                        int associationScopeId)
        Firstly, establishs a DeclarationEdge between a Scope and its Declaration. Then creates a AssociationEdge bewtween the Decalration and its associated Scope. Example: Adds Declaration B4 to the Scope1 and associates Scope3 to the Declaration B4 
             
      ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph();
      scopeGraph.generateScope(5);
      scopeGraph.makeAssociation(1, "B", 4, 3);
        Parameters:
        declarationScopeId - the scopeId of the Scope that has Declaration
        variableName - Declaration's name
        variableId - Declaration's Id
        associationScopeId - the scopeId of the Scope that will be assciated
        Returns:
        the Declaration

      • makeReference

        public model.scope.Name makeReference(int scopeId,
                                      java.lang.String variableName,
                                      int variableId)
        Establishs a ReferenceEdge between a Scope and its Reference Example: Adds the Reference x4 to Scope1 
            
     ScopeGraph scopeGraph = new ScopeGraph();
     scopeGraph.generateScope(1);
     scopeGraph.makeReference(1, "x", 4);
        Parameters:
        scopeId - the scopeId of the Scope that has Reference
        variableName - Reference's name
        variableId - Reference's Id
        Returns:
        the Reference

      • printDotForScopeGraph

        public void printDotForScopeGraph()
        Print Scope Graph in Dot language on the console Example: 
             
      ScopeGraph scopeGraph = ScopeGraphCreater.ScopeGraphFirgure2();
      scopeGraph.printDotForScopeGraph();

      • checkReference

        public model.scope.SearchResult checkReference(model.scope.Name reference)
        Passing in a reference to find the path from the Reference to its corresponding Definiton in the Scope Graph 
             
       ScopeGraph scopeGraph = ScopeGraphCreater.ScopeGrapFirgure3Left();
       Name referencen7 = scopeGraph.getName("n7");
       System.out.println(scopeGraph.checkReference(referencen7));
        Parameters:
        reference - the Reference that will be resolved
        Returns:
        a SearchResult which stored all of the possible paths.

      • checkImportModule

        public model.scope.SearchResult checkImportModule(model.scope.Name module)
        Passing in a importModule to find the path from the importModule to its corresponding definiton in the Scope Graph 
             
       ScopeGraph scopeGraph = ScopeGraphCreater.ScopeGraphFirgure3Right();
       Name moduleA5 = scopeGraph.getName("A5");
       System.out.println(scopeGraph.checkImportModule(moduleA5));
        Parameters:
        module - the Module that will be resolved
        Returns:
        a SearchResult which stored all of the possible paths.

      • getName

        public model.scope.Name getName(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the specific Name in Scope Graph by it's "variableName + variableId" Example: 
             
      ScopeGraph scopeGraph = ScopeGraphCreater.ScopeGraphFirgure3Right();
      Name moduleA5 = scopeGraph.getName("A5");
        Parameters:
        name - the Name that you want
        Returns:
        the Name or Null

      • selfCopy

        public ScopeGraph selfCopy()
        Create a new Scope Graph that does not share data with the original Scope Graph 
             
      ScopeGraph scopeGraph = ScopeGraphCreater.ScopeGrapFirgure3Left();
      ScopeGraph copy = scopeGraph.selfCopy();
      copy.printDotForScopeGraph();
        Returns:
        the new ScopeGraph
